creator: peter.steiner@acm.org
text:
I had two problems when using apr_pools.c from version 1.2.7 with the debugging
code enabled:

- My compiler (VC8 / VS2005) wouldn't compile it because of a difference
  of two void pointers
- I got an exception when opening the 'file_stderr' file. I tracked it down
  to apr_pool_log_event requests from within the file_open function that
  reference the not completely initialised 'file_stderr'.
  I solved this issue by using a temporary handle and assigning it to
  file_stderr only after the file_open function returns.

creator: peter.steiner@acm.org
text:
Created attachment 19194
Fixes both problems described

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
These are both excellent catches Peter, thanks a lot for submitting the patch. 
Committed to trunk:

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&rev=493834
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&rev=493838
